The correct ones are A and E, you can eliminate the other options just for the syntax error. It is a question that does not need a complex analysis. Always the "super()" or "super(var, var)" must come before "this" and it must be written "this.var = var;" anything outside of these other than instantiating by the class like "Animal.type t = type;" instead of the correct syntax of this is wrong.

discussion.content: The answer is the letter C. You don't need to explain much because the other alternatives are very wrong. But it's worth remembering that when we use * we import all the classes in the package but we don't import the classes of the sub-packages. Having this concept the others are wrong
